intro: Encelia laciniata, commonly known as the fringed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant has silvery, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into cylindrical, woody fruits. Encelia laciniata is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a hardy species in dry, coastal regions.
